title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Imaginary City", early 19th century
medium: Pen and brown ink on paper with uneven edges, lined with cream or light-brown paper
markings: Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a stage set.  Broad staircases leading up to a group of Classical temples of various shapes (rectangular and round).  A large arch spans above the staircases.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Imaginary City", early 19th century.
early 19th century. Pen and brown ink on paper with uneven edges, lined with cream or light-brown paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-401.
